title.narrative: F.a: Kenyan Indigenous Peoples Climate Policies Safeguards and Rights

description.narrative: Within the project 1) three workshops with forest-based indigenous peoples are organised in Kenya regarding mitigation safeguards and human rights norms and mechanisms, 2) three forest-based indigenous peoples’ delegate’s dialogue with national governm ent or related agencies is supported regarding safeguards mechanisms and standards and 3) IPACC materials on approaches for integrating indigenous and traditional knowledge into National Adaptation Plans are produced and launched at UNFCCC COP20 in Lima, P eru. The project aims to strengthen Kenyan forest-based indigenous peoples’ collaboration in developing climate change mitigation safeguards, support their advocacy on the theme towards the government, as well as contribute to including traditional knowl edge as part of the National Adaptation Plans. The mitigation aspect of the project benefits the Kenyan forest-based indigenous peoples (Sengwer, Ogiek and Yiaku), whereas the adaptation aspect benefits indigenous peoples across Africa. The approach and ac tivities have been designed and are implemented by the indigenous peoples themselves. IPACC was established as African indigenous peoples’ network in 1997 as African indigenous delegates participating in different UN fora recognised the need for collabor ation. It was registered as an independent NGO in South Africa in 2002. It has currently 133 member organisations in 23 countries, all of which are community based indigenous peoples’ organisations.IPACC aims to support a regional network of indigenous p eoples’ community based organisations across Africa to participate in UN and other multilateral policy forums, norms and standards setting processes, and to help members develop their capacity to lobby governments to promote and protect the rights of ind igenous peoples in line with the principles of the United Nations Declaration on the Rights of Indigenous Peoples. Themes addressed include human rights, gender equality, climate justice, environmental sustainability and natural resource governance. ipacc. org.za
